Classes

ServerSession

Members

autoAccept :Boolean

If this is true, the server will accept sessions automatically, otherwise, you should resolve sessions by calling Session#accept or Session#reject method.
Type:
  • Boolean
Default Value:
  • true
Source:
  • server.js, line 50

httpServer :Object

The Node http or https server instance to attach to.
Type:
  • Object
Default Value:
  • http.createServer();
Source:
  • server.js, line 43

timeout :number

The number of milliseconds of inactivity before a socket is presumed to have timed out.
Type:
  • number
Source:
  • server.js, line 179
See:
  • https://nodejs.org/api/http.html#http_server_timeout

address() → {Object}

Returns the bound address
Source:
  • server.js, line 130
Returns:
Type
Object

close(callbackopt)

Stops the server from accepting new sessions and keeps existing sessions. This function is asynchronous, the server is finally closed when all sessions are ended and the server emits a 'close' event.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
callback function <optional>
 A Listener for the 'close' event.
Source:
  • server.js, line 158

listen(port, hostopt, backlogopt, callbackopt)

Begin accepting sessions.
Parameters:
Name Type Attributes Description
port Number The listening IP.
host String <optional>
 The listening host.
backlog Number <optional>
 maximum length of the queue of pending sessions.
callback function <optional>
 A listener for the 'listening' event.

  • server.js, line 142
See:
  • https://nodejs.org/api/http.html#http_server_listen_port_hostname_backlog_callback
